intro: Antennaria howellii subsp. canadensis, commonly known as the Canadian mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early spring. This subspecies is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in open, sunny habitats.
